The axolotl (Ambystoma mexicanum) is a unique amphibian that has the ability to regrow its limbs. It is found in Mexico and is an important part of the country's ecosystem. Axolotls are carnivorous and feed on a variety of invertebrates, including worms, crustaceans, and mollusks. They have evolved to live in a variety of aquatic environments, including lakes, canals, and wetlands. Axolotls have become popular exotic pets, but their capture and trade have threatened their populations in the wild. Conservation efforts are underway to protect the axolotl and its habitat.

The massive creature was a herbivore and likely lived in a forested area with shallow water bodies. Its fossil remains were found in Patagonia, Argentina, in 2005 by a team led by Dr. Kenneth Lacovara. The dinosaur's skeleton is one of the most complete ever found, with almost 45% of its bones intact. It is estimated to have weighed around 26 tons and reached lengths of up to 26 meters.

Extract Ethnicity, Era, Event, Location, Emperor, Dynasty, Date, Chinese Character, Animal, and Element From the following text:

The Eastern Han dynasty was a period of relative peace and prosperity in China, marked by the reign of the virtuous Emperor Zhang. He was known for his just and fair policies, which brought great harmony to the land. During his reign, the famous Terracotta Army was unearthed in Xi'an, Shaanxi province. According to legend, this life-sized army of over 8,000 soldiers was buried with the first emperor of China, Qin Shi Huang, to protect him in the afterlife. The Terracotta Army was discovered in 1974 by local farmers who stumbled upon the site while digging a well. The tomb of Qin Shi Huang is said to be hidden deep within a pyramid-shaped mound, surrounded by a network of underground tunnels and chambers. The site is considered one of the greatest archaeological discoveries of the 20th century.

The Flying Fish Exit 11 Hoppy Pale Ale is a citrusy and refreshing brew with a flavor profile that's balanced between bitter and sweet. This beer is brewed with a blend of citrus-forward hops, including Amarillo, Citra, and Mosaic, which provide a bright orange and lemon flavor. The brewery uses a unique fermentation process that involves a combination of warm and cold fermentation temperatures to bring out the vibrant hop flavors. With an IBU of 45 and an ABV of 5.5%, this beer is perfect for hop heads who want a balanced and sessionable brew. Flying Fish Brewing Company, located in Somerdale, New Jersey, has been brewing since 1996 and is known for its creative and delicious beers. Exit 11 is available year-round in 6-packs of 12 oz bottles and 1/2 kegs. This beer pairs well with spicy foods, seafood, and salads.

The galaxy GN-z11 is seen as it was just 400 million years after the Big Bang, when the universe was still in its early stages of formation. Observations of the galaxy's light spectrum reveal that it is a small, low-mass galaxy that is rapidly forming stars. The galaxy is too distant to be seen in visible light, so astronomers used the Hubble Space Telescope's Wide Field Camera 3 to capture its faint infrared glow. The galaxy's light has been stretched and shifted towards the red end of the spectrum due to the expansion of the universe, a phenomenon known as redshift. By analyzing the redshift, astronomers can infer how fast the galaxy is moving away from us and how far away it is. GN-z11 is currently the most distant galaxy observed, with a light travel time of 13.4 billion years.

The Hungarian Parliament Building is a spectacular example of Neo-Gothic architecture, located in Budapest, Hungary. It was designed by Hungarian architect Imre Steindl and took 19 years to complete, finally opening in 1904. The building features a stunning 691 rooms, including 20 kilometers of corridors and 10 courtyards. The main dome stands at an impressive 96 meters tall, and the building is 268 meters long and 118 meters wide at its widest point, narrowing to 45 meters at its narrowest. The building faces the Danube River and is home to the Hungarian government, including the Office of the Prime Minister, the President of the Republic, and the Ministry of the Interior. The building also features statues of Hungarian kings, including Stephen I and Saint Ladislaus. Visitors can take guided tours of the building, and more information can be found on the official website.

Extract Island, Location, Capital City, Population, Language, Currency, Government, Area, Continent, Terrain, Climate, Natural Resources, Border Countries, Economy, Main Industries, Exports from the following text:

Iceland is an island country located in the North Atlantic Ocean, situated between Europe and North America. The capital and largest city is Reykjavik. As of 2020, the population of Iceland is approximately 360,000 people. The official language of Iceland is Icelandic, and the currency is the Icelandic króna. Iceland is a parliamentary republic and a representative democracy. The country has a total area of around 103,000 square kilometers, making it slightly larger than the state of Kentucky in the United States. Iceland is located on the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, which runs down the center of the Atlantic Ocean, and its unique landscape is characterized by volcanic mountains, geysers, and hot springs. The climate is generally mild and temperate, with cold winters and mild summers. Natural resources include fish, renewable energy, and minerals. Iceland shares borders with no other countries, but it is bordered by the Greenland Sea to the north, the Norwegian Sea to the east, and the Atlantic Ocean to the south and west. The economy of Iceland is largely based on fishing and tourism, with a growing sector of renewable energy. The main industries are fishing, aluminum smelting, and tourism. Iceland's main exports are fish products, aluminum, and ferro-silicon.

The Journal of Jurassic Research (JJR) is a peer-reviewed scientific journal that publishes original research articles, review articles, and short communications in the field of Jurassic geology and paleontology. The journal is published quarterly by the International Association of Jurassic Research (IAJR) and is indexed in the Science Citation Index Expanded. The editor-in-chief is Dr. Jane Smith. The journal's impact factor is 2.5. In the current issue, there is a research article titled "A new species of Jurassic dinosaur from Patagonia" by Dr. John Doe and Dr. Maria Rodriguez. The article describes the discovery of a new species of sauropod dinosaur from the Jurassic period in Patagonia, Argentina. The authors used a combination of morphological and phylogenetic analyses to characterize the new species. The article concludes that the new species provides important insights into the evolution of sauropod dinosaurs during the Jurassic period. The DOI of the article is 10.1038/jjr.2022.02. The abstract of the article is available online. The article has been cited 10 times so far. The research was funded by the National Science Foundation (NSF) and the Argentine Ministry of Science and Technology. The authors declare no conflict of interest. The study was approved by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) of the University of California.

The Komodo dragon is a large, carnivorous species found in the Indonesian islands of Komodo, Rinca, Flores, and Gili Motang. It is a member of the monitor lizard family and is known for its distinctive appearance and powerful venom. The Komodo dragon is the largest lizard species, growing up to 3 meters in length and weighing up to 70 kilograms. It is a top predator in its ecosystem and plays a crucial role in maintaining the balance of its environment. The Komodo dragon is listed as a vulnerable species due to habitat loss, poaching, and human-wildlife conflict.

The "Madonna of the Yarnwinder" is a small painting attributed to the Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci, created in the early 16th century. The painting depicts the Virgin Mary holding the Christ Child and a yarnwinder, which symbolizes the virtue of spinning. The painting is considered one of Da Vinci's finest works and is now held at the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. The painting measures 45.7 cm x 31.4 cm and is painted in oil on a single piece of walnut wood. The "Madonna of the Yarnwinder" has been the subject of much speculation and debate among art historians, with some attributing it to Da Vinci's assistant, Salaì. Despite this, the painting remains a beloved and revered work of Renaissance art.

The oceanographers from the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution embarked on an expedition to explore the depths of the oligotrophic ocean in the OPEN region of the North Atlantic Ocean. Led by Dr. Maria Rodriguez, the team deployed the autonomous underwater vehicle (AUV) to collect data on the ocean currents and marine life in the area. The AUV dived to a depth of approximately 3,000 meters, where it recorded a temperature of 2°C and a salinity of 34.5 ppt. The team discovered a hydrothermal vent, which was teeming with unique marine life, including giant tube worms and vent crabs. The GPS coordinates of the vent were 35° 45' N, 53° 30' W. The data collected from the expedition will provide valuable insights into the ocean's ecosystem and help scientists better understand the ocean's role in the Earth's climate system.

The quasar is surrounded by a massive galaxy, which is thought to have formed during the early universe's reionization period. The team used ALMA's high spatial resolution to image the quasar's host galaxy, revealing a complex structure with multiple components. The observations were conducted on February 10, 2020, with an exposure time of 2 hours, and the data were published in the Astrophysical Journal on March 15, 2022.

The discovery of the ナガサキフトキ (Nagasaki flying fox) was first recorded in 1605 by a Dutch trader named François Caron. This species is endemic to Japan and can be found on the islands of Honshu, Shikoku, and Kyushu. The Nagasaki flying fox is a large fruit bat with a body length of around 25 cm and a wingspan of up to 1.5 m. Its fur is dark brown to black, with a distinctive golden-brown patch on the neck. The Habitat of the Nagasaki flying fox includes subtropical forests, tropical forests, and urban areas. The main threats to this species are habitat destruction, hunting, and climate change. Conservation efforts are underway to protect the Nagasaki flying fox and its habitats.

The tranquil Twin Lakes, situated in the Township of Tiny, Ontario, Canada, are a popular destination for tourists and nature enthusiasts alike. The lakes are known for their turquoise waters, which are maintained by the Township's careful management of the lakes' ecosystem. On a typical summer day, the lakes' surface temperature reaches around 22°C, with a moderate wind speed of 10 km/h. The lakes' water level is regulated by a control structure, which ensures a consistent water level throughout the year. According to the Township's water quality report, the lakes' turbidity is relatively low, ranging from 0.5 to 1.5 NTU, and their transparency is high, with a visibility of up to 4 meters. The lakes' trophic state is classified as oligotrophic, with low levels of total nitrogen and total phosphorus. The pH level of the lakes is slightly alkaline, ranging from 7.5 to 8.5. The Township conducts regular water quality monitoring to ensure the lakes remain healthy and safe for recreational activities.

The Fiscal Year (FY) 2022 Forestry Incentives Program (FIP) is a competitive grant program that provides financial assistance to state forestry agencies, federally recognized tribes, and private forest landowners to promote forest health, productivity, and sustainability on private forestlands. The FY 2022 FIP program is funded by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) Forest Service, and is authorized by the Food, Conservation, and Energy Act of 2008. The program's goal is to encourage private forest landowners to practice sustainable forestry and reforestation, and to promote forest stewardship. The funding amount for the FY 2022 FIP program is $10 million. The program is managed by the USDA Forest Service, with assistance from state forestry agencies and federally recognized tribes. The application period for the FY 2022 FIP program will begin on March 1, 2022, and end on May 15, 2022.

The patient, a 45-year-old female, presented to our clinic with complaints of numbness and tingling in her left hand. She reported that the symptoms started three months ago and have been progressively worsening. Her medical history is significant for hypertension and hyperlipidemia. She is currently taking lisinopril and atorvastatin. Her family history is positive for stroke and hypertension. She denies any allergies. Her social history is significant for smoking one pack of cigarettes per day for the past 20 years. Neurological exam revealed decreased sensation in the left hand, especially in the fourth and fifth fingers. MRI of the brain and cervical spine revealed a small disc protrusion at C6-C7, which is compressing the spinal cord. We started her on gabapentin 100mg three times a day and scheduled a follow-up appointment in two weeks to reassess her symptoms.

The uranium ore concentrate sample (UOC-123) was collected from the uranium mine site in Uzbekistan on February 10, 2020. The sample was crushed and pulverized to a fine powder using a jaw crusher and a ring mill. The uranium enrichment level was determined using a technique called thermal ionization mass spectrometry (TIMS). The uranium-235 content was found to be 3.45% and the total uranium content was 85.12%. The sample was analyzed at the Nuclear Forensic Laboratory using a combination of TIMS and inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS).

Extract X-Ray Energy, X-Ray Intensity, Detector Material, Energy Range, Sample Type, Crystal Structure, Beamline, Research Focus, Analysis Software from the following text, if you cannot find the answer say N/A. The text is:
X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS) is a widely used technique to study the local atomic structure of materials. At the XAS beamline, a monochromatic X-ray beam with an energy range of 4.5-14 keV is focused onto a sample using a Si(111) crystal monochromator. The X-ray beam is then detected using a 13-element Ge detector. The sample is typically placed in a vacuum chamber to prevent absorption of the X-ray beam by air. The XAS beamline is equipped with a furnace that allows for in-situ heating of the sample up to 1000°C. This enables the study of temperature-dependent changes in the local atomic structure of materials. The beamline is also equipped with a cryostat that allows for cooling of the sample to -200°C.

Asthma Awareness Month is observed every April in the United States. The Alabama Department of Public Health (ADPH) is joining other agencies across the country to increase awareness about the risks associated with asthma. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), more than 8% of Americans have asthma, which is a leading cause of school and work absences. The ADPH is urging residents to take simple steps to reduce their risk of asthma attacks, including reducing exposure to common allergens like dust mites, mold, and pet dander. Residents can also take advantage of free asthma screenings at local health clinics. The ADPH has allocated an annual budget of $1 million to support asthma awareness and education initiatives.

COLUMBUS, Ohio - A Columbus police officer is under investigation after a chase ended in a crash on the city's east side. According to the Columbus Police Department, the incident occurred around 2:30 a.m. on Thursday when an officer attempted to pull over a vehicle for a traffic violation. The driver, described as a 30-year-old man with a medium build and short brown hair, fled the scene, leading the officer on a pursuit. The chase ended when the suspect's vehicle crashed into a pole near the intersection of Cleveland Avenue and Cartwright Road. The officer was not injured, but the suspect was taken to Grant Medical Center for treatment of minor injuries. The incident is under investigation, and no arrests have been made. Authorities are reviewing dashcam footage and seeking witnesses to come forward.

Extract Fire Station, Number of Firefighters, Type of Emergency, Response Time, Location From the following text, if you cannot find the answer say N/A.

The text is:
FRESNO, Calif. — A fast-moving fire sparked by a faulty electrical wire ripped through a Fresno apartment complex Friday morning, forcing firefighters to rescue several people from balconies. The Fresno Fire Department responded to the blaze at the Fountain Court Apartments around 9:30 a.m. after multiple 911 calls reported flames shooting from the building. Firefighters from Station 10, led by Capt. Jesse Gonzalez, were the first to arrive on the scene. They quickly went to work rescuing people stranded on their balconies. "When we got here, we saw people hanging out of their windows, screaming for help," Gonzalez said. In all, firefighters rescued six people from the burning building, including a 4-year-old child. The fire was brought under control within 20 minutes, but not before it caused significant damage to several units.

The Fresno Fire Department responded to the blaze at the Fountain Court Apartments around 9:30 a.m. after multiple 911 calls reported flames shooting from the building. Firefighters from Station 10, led by Capt. Jesse Gonzalez, were the first to arrive on the scene. They quickly went to work rescuing people stranded on their balconies. "When we got here, we saw people hanging out of their windows, screaming for help," Gonzalez said. In all, firefighters rescued six people from the burning building, including a 4-year-old child. The fire was brought under control within 20 minutes, but not before it caused significant damage to several units.

Extract Kilimanjaro Region, Date, Elevation, Weather Conditions, Climbers Involved, Reason for Attempt, Rescue Efforts from the following text, if you cannot find the answer say N/A.

The text is: 
"Tanzanian authorities say a 35-year-old Kenyan climber, Joseph Kipkemoi, died on Monday while attempting to reach the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak. According to a statement from the Kilimanjaro National Park authorities, Kipkemoi was accompanied by two guides when he fell sick at an altitude of 5,700 meters (18,700 feet) above sea level. The incident occurred on the Marangu route, which is one of the most popular routes to the summit. The authorities say Kipkemoi was attempting to reach the summit as part of a fundraising effort for a local hospital. The climbers reported that the weather conditions were good, with clear skies and moderate winds. However, the temperature was quite low, ranging from -10 to -15 degrees Celsius (14-5 degrees Fahrenheit). Rescuers from the Kilimanjaro National Park and the Tanzanian military were involved in the rescue efforts, but they were unable to save Kipkemoi's life."

The police department's Narcotics Unit has seen a significant increase in drug-related activity in the area over the past few months, which has led to a rise in non-fatal shootings.

The Peace Pagoda, a prominent landmark in Portsmouth, is a 100-foot-tall Buddhist stupa built in 1988. Located in Victoria Park, the pagoda was designed by architect Nicholas Grimshaw and built at a cost of £1 million. The pagoda was inaugurated by the Mayor of Portsmouth, Johnrez Taylor, on August 15, 1988. The pagoda is open daily from 10am to 5pm and admission is free, although donations are welcomed. Visitors can climb to the top of the pagoda for a panoramic view of the city. The pagoda's design is influenced by traditional Japanese architecture and is one of 80 similar pagodas built around the world by the Nipponzan-Myohoji Buddhist Order. Today, the Peace Pagoda remains a popular tourist attraction in Portsmouth, attracting thousands of visitors every year.

The geological formations found in the quarry are primarily made up of granite and gneiss, with smaller amounts of schist and quartzite."

Context: "Tanzania's tourism industry is booming, with a significant increase in tourist arrivals in the past year. The country's stunning natural beauty, rich cultural heritage, and wildlife reserves make it an attractive destination for tourists. Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak, is a major draw for adventure seekers and trekkers. The Ngorongoro Conservation Area, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is home to an abundance of wildlife, including the Big Five. The Tanzania National Parks Authority has reported a significant increase in visitors to Serengeti National Park, known for its annual migration of wildebeests. Tour operators such as Thomson Safaris and Tanzania Wildlife Safari are cashing in on the boom, offering bespoke safari experiences to tourists. The best time to visit Tanzania is during the dry season, from June to October. The local currency is the Tanzanian shilling, and the official language is Swahili."

Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak, is a major draw for adventure seekers and trekkers. The Ngorongoro Conservation Area, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is home to an abundance of wildlife, including the Big Five. The Tanzania National Parks Authority has reported a significant increase in visitors to Serengeti National Park, known for its annual migration of wildebeests. Tour operators such as Thomson Safaris and Tanzania Wildlife Safari are cashing in on the boom, offering bespoke safari experiences to tourists. The best time to visit Tanzania is during the dry season, from June to October. The local currency is the Tanzanian shilling, and the official language is Swahili.

The program is highly interdisciplinary, combining coursework from the departments of Biology, Geography, Architecture, and Environmental Studies. The deadline to apply for Fall semester is February 15, and the tuition fee for Utah residents is $25,000 per year. The university has a diverse student body of around 25,000 students, with a campus setting that is classified as urban. The University of Utah is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities. The faculty-student ratio is 1:14, and the academic calendar follows a semester-based system. The acceptance rate is 67%, and the graduation rate is 70%. The most popular majors at the university are Business, Nursing, and Engineering. Around 10% of the student body consists of international students. On-campus housing is available, with several options to choose from, including dormitories and apartments.

Wolong National Nature Reserve, located in Sichuan Province, China, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular destination for animal lovers and eco-tourists. The reserve is home to more than 4,000 giant pandas, as well as other endangered species such as the red panda, the golden monkey, and the white-lipped deer. Wolong is also a key habitat for the snow leopard, which is listed as Vulnerable on the IUCN Red List. The reserve covers an area of 2,000 square kilometers and has an elevation range of 1,150 to 6,050 meters above sea level. Wolong National Nature Reserve was established in 1963 and is managed by the Sichuan Provincial Forestry Department. The reserve's website is www.wolongChina.org.

Extract Xenopus species, Habitat, Body length, Diet, Conservation status, Breeding season, Predators, Unique feature, Adaptation mechanism, Interesting fact from the following text:

Xenopus laevis, also known as the African clawed frog, is a species of aquatic frog native to sub-Saharan Africa. They inhabit ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams, and are often found in areas with dense vegetation. The African clawed frog has a distinctive claw-like structure on its hind legs, which it uses for defense and to capture prey. They can grow up to 5 cm in body length, and their diet consists mainly of aquatic invertebrates such as insects and crustaceans. The species is currently classified as least concern on the IUCN Red List, but habitat destruction and the introduction of invasive species pose potential threats to its population. Breeding season typically occurs during the rainy season, and females can lay up to 2,000 eggs at a time. The African clawed frog has a unique ability to regrow its limbs if they are injured or lost. This species is also used extensively in scientific research, particularly in the fields of developmental biology and neurobiology.

Job Title: GIS Analyst

Company: Geospatial Systems Inc.

Location: Gaithersburg, MD

Job Type: Full-time

Job Description:

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced GIS Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting geospatial data, creating maps and reports, and providing technical support to our clients. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in geography, computer science, or a related field, and experience with ArcGIS, Python, and SQL.

* Analyze and interpret geospatial data to identify trends and patterns
* Create maps, reports, and other visualizations to present findings to clients
* Provide technical support to clients on the use of GIS software and data
* Collaborate with other team members to develop and implement GIS projects
* Stay up-to-date with new developments and technologies in the field of GIS

Job Title: Wildlife Biologist
Wildlife Trust is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Wildlife Biologist to join our team. The successful candidate will work closely with our conservation team to develop and implement effective conservation strategies for the welfare of woodland wildlife. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of woodland ecosystems and the species that inhabit them, including the white-tailed woodrat, woodland caribou, and woodland jumping mouse. Key responsibilities will include conducting field research, monitoring wildlife populations, and collaborating with stakeholders to develop conservation plans. The ideal candidate will have a PhD in Wildlife Biology or a related field and at least 5 years of experience in a similar role.

"We are seeking an experienced X-ray Scientist to join our team in the development of new X-ray detectors for medical imaging applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in X-ray physics and detectors, with experience in designing and testing X-ray detectors for various applications. The X-ray detector should be capable of operating in the energy range of 20-100 keV and have a high detection efficiency. The successful candidate will work closely with our cross-functional team to develop and test new X-ray detectors, and will be responsible for characterizing detector performance and optimizing detector design. Applications of the X-ray detectors include medical imaging, non-destructive testing, and security screening."

"Yoga Instructor needed for our yoga studio in Yellow Springs. We are seeking a yoga instructor to teach various yoga styles, including Hatha, Vinyasa, and Restorative yoga. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience teaching yoga and a strong understanding of yoga principles and breathing techniques. Our classes are typically 60-75 minutes long and are designed for students of all experience levels. We offer a variety of class types, including hot yoga, yin yoga, and yoga workshops. Our focus areas include stress reduction, flexibility, and strength building. Equipment needed includes yoga mats, blocks, straps, and blankets. This is a part-time position with opportunities for advancement."

Extract Zoologist, Location, Job Type, Job Description, Required Qualifications from the following job posting:

The Zoological Wildlife Foundation (ZWF) is seeking a dedicated and experienced Zoologist to join our team at the ZWF Zoological Park in Zimmerman, Zambia. The successful candidate will be responsible for the daily care and management of our diverse animal collection, including big cats, primates, and reptiles. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in zoology, animal behavior, and wildlife conservation, with a minimum of 5 years of experience working in a zoological institution. The ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and communicate clearly with colleagues and visitors is essential.
